title: Umbrella weather in Odisha as deep depression heads toward coast
text:
Next Article
Umbrella weather in Odisha as deep depression heads toward coast
India
Odisha is in for some serious rain as a deep depression from the Bay of Bengal heads toward its coast.
The system picked up strength on Wednesday night, soaking coastal and southern areas.
On Thursday, the IMD put all 30 districts on heavy rain alert, so it's definitely umbrella weather across the state.
Red alert for Puri, Jagatsinghpur
The IMD has flagged "red" alerts for Puri and Jagatsinghpur (expecting over 20cm rain), "orange" for 14 districts, and "yellow" elsewhere.
The government isn't taking chancesâ€”teams and gear are ready in flood-prone spots, fishermen have been told to stay off the sea till October 3, and ports are on high alert for strong winds.
The system is set to cross between Gopalpur and Paradip by the night of October 2.
